page.title: 09MIDLEM VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: {The village}has a blacksmith's shop, a sub-post office, and a glass engraver. The rest of the workers travel to Selkirk, Galashiels or Hawick. The primary school children go to Lilliesleaf and the older ones to Selkirk High School by school bus. Many of the population are retired, some from local towns and farms. {The Post Office}stocks sweets and cigarettes, and vans come with fish, vegetables, meat and groceries. A bank opens in the village hall once a week. A Library Van comes once a fortnight. {The Village Hall}is used for Women's Rural Institute, whist drives and fund-raising events for charity. {The Post Bus}takes passengers to and from Galashiels every day. {The Border Courier}goes from Midlem to Peel Hospital on Tuesdays and Thursdays, by Selkirk and Galashiels.
